critique: The document is an executive order focused on improving air quality by preventing and controlling air pollution from Federal Government activities. It directs federal agencies to minimize emissions, construct new facilities to meet air quality objectives, and develop plans for existing facilities to prevent or abate air pollution. It emphasizes cooperation with the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare and compliance with the Clean Air Act. The order also sets objectives for Federal facilities and buildings, including conforming to state or community air pollution standards, minimizing emissions of flyash, particulate matter, and sulfur oxides, and properly storing and handling fuels and refuse.
